intro: Microstylis monophyllos subsp. brachypoda, commonly known as the narrow-styled microstylis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The subspecies is distinguished by its short, narrow inflorescence and reduced floral structures. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
